I still don't like it. It means having the signature line edit writeable when you may just want to sign and have that generated...and it means having the address book and paste buttons enabled when you might just want to validate. It also means the order of elements on the page is not necessarily what you want to see (i.e. to verify, you fill in message, then skip address, then fill in signature).
While validation is more of an advanced tool, signing is basics. Perhaps a UI expert should provide input on how to best integrate them together.\n

Good, indeed it was asymmetric to have signing without verifying, this at least makes it complete.
